Nim bindings for WebUI

Example:

import webui/bindings

let window = newWindow() # Create a new Window
window.show("<html>Hello</html>") # Show the window with html content in any browser

wait() # Wait until the window gets closed

Types

Event {.bycopy.} = object
  window*: csize_t           ## The window object number
  eventType*: csize_t        ## Event type
  element*: cstring          ## HTML element ID
  eventNumber*: csize_t      ## Internal WebUI
  bindId*: csize_t           ## Bind ID
  
WebuiBrowser = enum
  wbNoBrowser,              ## 0. No web browser
  wbAny,                    ## 1. Default recommended web browser
  wbChrome,                 ## 2. Google Chrome
  wbFirefox,                ## 3. Mozilla Firefox
  wbEdge,                   ## 4. Microsoft Edge
  wbSafari,                 ## 5. Apple Safari
  wbChromium,               ## 6. The Chromium Project
  wbOpera,                  ## 7. Opera Browser
  wbBrave,                  ## 8. The Brave Browser
  wbVivaldi,                ## 9. The Vivaldi Browser
  wbEpic,                   ## 10. The Epic Browser
  wbYandex,                 ## 11. The Yandex Browser
  wbChromiumBased            ## 12. Any Chromium based browser
WebuiConfig = enum
  wcShowWaitConnection, ## Control if `show()` and `showX()` (e.g. `showBrowser()` & `showWv`) should wait
                         ## for the window to connect before returns or not.
                         ## 
                         ## Default: `true`
  wcUiEventBlocking, ## Control if WebUI should block and process the UI events one a time in a single
                      ## thread (`true`), or process every event in a new non-blocking thread (`false`).
                      ## This updates all windows. You can use `setEventBlocking()` for a specific single
                      ## window update.
                      ## 
                      ## Default: `false`
  wcFolderMonitor ## Automatically refresh the window UI when any file in the root folder changes
                  ## 
                  ## Default: `false`
WebuiEvent = enum
  weDisconnected,           ## 0. Window disconnection event
  weConnected,              ## 1. Window connection event
  weMultiConnection,        ## 2. New window connection event
  weUnwantedConnection,     ## 3. New unwanted window connection event
  weMouseClick,             ## 4. Mouse click event
  weNavigation,             ## 5. Window navigation event
  weCallback                 ## 6. Function call event
WebuiRuntime = enum
  wrNone,                   ## 0. Prevent WebUI from using any runtime for .js and .ts files
  wrDeno,                   ## 1. Use Deno runtime for .js and .ts files
  wrNodeJs                   ## 2. Use Nodejs runtime for .js files

Consts

Any {....deprecated: "Use `wbAny` instead".} = wbAny
Brave {....deprecated: "Use `wbBrave` instead".} = wbBrave
Chrome {....deprecated: "Use `wbChrome` instead".} = wbChrome
Chromium {....deprecated: "Use `wbChromium` instead".} = wbChromium
ChromiumBased {....deprecated: "Use `wbChromiumBased` instead".} = wbChromiumBased
Deno {....deprecated: "Use `wrDeno` instead".} = wrDeno
Edge {....deprecated: "Use `wbEdge` instead".} = wbEdge
Epic {....deprecated: "Use `wbEpic` instead".} = wbEpic
EventsCallback {....deprecated: "Use `weCallback` instead".} = weCallback
EventsConnected {....deprecated: "Use `weConnected` instead".} = weConnected
EventsDisconnected {....deprecated: "Use `weDisconnected` instead".} = weDisconnected
EventsMouseClick {....deprecated: "Use `weMouseClick` instead".} = weMouseClick
EventsMultiConnection {....deprecated: "Use `weMultiConnection` instead".} = weMultiConnection
EventsNavigation {....deprecated: "Use `weNavigation` instead".} = weNavigation
EventsUnwantedConnection {....deprecated: "Use `weUnwantedConnection` instead".} = weUnwantedConnection
Firefox {....deprecated: "Use `wbFirefox` instead".} = wbFirefox
NoBrowser {....deprecated: "Use `wbNoBrowser` instead".} = wbNoBrowser
NodeJs {....deprecated: "Use `wrNodeJs` instead".} = wrNodeJs
None {....deprecated: "Use `wrNone` instead".} = wrNone
Opera {....deprecated: "Use `wbOpera` instead".} = wbOpera
Safari {....deprecated: "Use `wbSafari` instead".} = wbSafari
useWebuiDll = false
useWebuiStaticLib = false
Vivaldi {....deprecated: "Use `wbVivaldi` instead".} = wbVivaldi
WEBUI_MAX_ARG = 16
WEBUI_MAX_IDS = 256
WEBUI_VERSION = "2.5.0-Beta.1"
Version 
Yandex {....deprecated: "Use `wbYandex` instead".} = wbYandex

Procs

proc `bind`(window: csize_t; element: cstring;
            func: proc (e: ptr Event) {.cdecl.}): csize_t {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_bind", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Bind a specific html element click event with a function. Empty element means all events. 
proc browserExist(browser: WebuiBrowser): bool {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_browser_exist", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Check if a web browser is installed. 
proc clean() {.cdecl, importc: "webui_clean", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Free all memory resources. Should be called only at the end. 
proc close(window: csize_t) {.cdecl, importc: "webui_close", ...raises: [],
                              tags: [], forbids: [].}
Close a specific window only. The window object will still exist. 
proc decode(str: cstring): cstring {.cdecl, importc: "webui_decode", ...raises: [],
                                     tags: [], forbids: [].}
Base64 decoding. Use this to safely decode received Base64 text from the UI. If it fails it will return nil. The returned buffer must be freed. 
proc deleteAllProfiles() {.cdecl, importc: "webui_delete_all_profiles",
                           ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Delete all local web-browser profiles folder. It should called at the end. 
proc deleteProfile(window: csize_t) {.cdecl, importc: "webui_delete_profile",
                                      ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Delete a specific window web-browser local folder profile. 
proc destroy(window: csize_t) {.cdecl, importc: "webui_destroy", ...raises: [],
                                tags: [], forbids: [].}
Close a specific window and free all memory resources. 
proc encode(str: cstring): cstring {.cdecl, importc: "webui_encode", ...raises: [],
                                     tags: [], forbids: [].}
Base64 encoding. Use this to safely send text based data to the UI. If it fails it will return nil. The returned buffer must be freed. 
proc exit() {.cdecl, importc: "webui_exit", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Close all open windows. wait() will return (Break). 
proc free(ptr: pointer) {.cdecl, importc: "webui_free", ...raises: [], tags: [],
                          forbids: [].}
Safely free a buffer allocated by WebUI using malloc(). 
proc getBestBrowser(window: csize_t): csize_t {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_get_best_browser", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get the "best" browser to be used. If running show() or passing wbAnyBrowser to showBrowser(), this function will return the same browser that will be used. 
proc getBool(e: ptr Event): csize_t {.cdecl, importc: "webui_get_bool",
                                      ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get the first argument as boolean 
proc getBoolAt(e: ptr Event; index: csize_t): csize_t {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_get_bool_at", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get an argument as boolean at a specific index 
proc getChildProcessId(window: csize_t): csize_t {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_get_child_process_id", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get the ID of the last child process. 
proc getCount(e: ptr Event): csize_t {.cdecl, importc: "webui_get_count",
                                       ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get how many arguments there are in an event. 
proc getFloat(e: ptr Event): cdouble {.cdecl, importc: "webui_get_float",
                                       ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get the first argument as float 
proc getFloatAt(e: ptr Event; index: csize_t): cdouble {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_get_float_at", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get an argument as float at a specific index 
proc getInt(e: ptr Event): clonglong {.cdecl, importc: "webui_get_int",
                                       ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get the first argument as integer 
proc getIntAt(e: ptr Event; index: csize_t): clonglong {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_get_int_at", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get an argument as integer at a specific index 
proc getNewWindowId(): csize_t {.cdecl, importc: "webui_get_new_window_id",
                                 ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get a free window number that can be used with newWindowId() 
proc getParentProcessId(window: csize_t): csize_t {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_get_parent_process_id", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get the ID of the parent process (The web browser may re-create another new process). 
proc getSize(e: ptr Event): csize_t {.cdecl, importc: "webui_get_size",
                                      ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get size in bytes of the first argument 
proc getSizeAt(e: ptr Event; index: csize_t): csize_t {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_get_size_at", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get the size in bytes of an argument at a specific index 
proc getString(e: ptr Event): cstring {.cdecl, importc: "webui_get_string",
                                        ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get the first argument as string 
proc getStringAt(e: ptr Event; index: csize_t): cstring {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_get_string_at", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get an argument as string at a specific index 
proc getUrl(window: csize_t): cstring {.cdecl, importc: "webui_get_url",
                                        ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get current URL of a running window. 
proc interfaceBind(window: csize_t; element: cstring; func: proc (
    window: csize_t; eventType: csize_t; element: cstring; eventNumber: csize_t;
    bindId: csize_t) {.cdecl.}): csize_t {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_interface_bind", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Bind a specific HTML element click event with a function. Empty element means all events.
func:The callback as myFunc(Window, EventType, Element, EventNumber, BindID)
proc interfaceGetBoolAt(window: csize_t; event_number: csize_t; index: csize_t): bool {.
    cdecl, importc: "webui_interface_get_bool_at", ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Get an argument as boolean at a specific index 
proc interfaceGetIntAt(window: csize_t; event_number: csize_t; index: csize_t): clonglong {.
    cdecl, importc: "webui_interface_get_int_at", ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Get an argument as integer at a specific index 
proc interfaceGetSizeAt(window: csize_t; event_number: csize_t; index: csize_t): csize_t {.
    cdecl, importc: "webui_interface_get_size_at", ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Get the size in bytes of an argument at a specific index 
proc interfaceGetStringAt(window: csize_t; event_number: csize_t; index: csize_t): cstring {.
    cdecl, importc: "webui_interface_get_string_at", ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Get an argument as string at a specific index 
proc interfaceGetWindowId(window: csize_t): csize_t {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_interface_get_window_id", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get a unique window ID. 
proc interfaceIsAppRunning(): bool {.cdecl,
                                     importc: "webui_interface_is_app_running",
                                     ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Check if the app still running or not. This replaces wait(). 
proc interfaceSetResponse(window: csize_t; event_number: csize_t;
                          repsonse: cstring) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_interface_set_response", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
When using interfaceBind(), you may need this function to easily set a response. 
proc isHighContrast(): bool {.cdecl, importc: "webui_is_high_contrast",
                              ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Get the OS's high contrast preference. 
proc isShown(window: csize_t): bool {.cdecl, importc: "webui_is_shown",
                                      ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Check if the specified window is still running. 
proc malloc(size: csize_t): pointer {.cdecl, importc: "webui_malloc",
                                      ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Safely allocate memory using the WebUI memory management system. It can be safely freed using free() at any time. 
proc navigate(window: csize_t; url: cstring) {.cdecl, importc: "webui_navigate",
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Navigate to a specific URL 
proc newWindow(): csize_t {.cdecl, importc: "webui_new_window", ...raises: [],
                            tags: [], forbids: [].}
Create a new WebUI window object. 
proc newWindowId(windowNumber: csize_t): csize_t {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_new_window_id", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Create a new webui window object using a specified window number. 
proc returnBool(e: ptr Event; b: bool) {.cdecl, importc: "webui_return_bool",
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Return the response to JavaScript as boolean. 
proc returnFloat(e: ptr Event; f: cdouble) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_return_float", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Return the response to JavaScript as integer. 
proc returnInt(e: ptr Event; n: clonglong) {.cdecl, importc: "webui_return_int",
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Return the response to JavaScript as integer. 
proc returnString(e: ptr Event; s: cstring) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_return_string", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Return the response to JavaScript as string. 
proc run(window: csize_t; script: cstring) {.cdecl, importc: "webui_run",
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Run JavaScript without waiting for the response. 
proc script(window: csize_t; script: cstring; timeout: csize_t; buffer: cstring;
            bufferLength: csize_t): bool {.cdecl, importc: "webui_script",
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Run JavaScript and get the response back. Make sure your local buffer can hold the response. 
proc sendRaw(window: csize_t; function: cstring; raw: pointer; size: csize_t) {.
    cdecl, importc: "webui_send_raw", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Safely send raw data to the UI. 
proc setConfig(option: WebuiConfig; status: bool) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_config", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Control WebUI's behaviour. It's better to this call at the beginning. 
proc setDefaultRootFolder(path: cstring): bool {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_default_set_root_folder", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set the web-server root folder path for all windows. Should be used before show(). 
proc setEventBlocking(window: csize_t; status: bool) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_event_blocking", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Control if UI events comming from this window should be processed one a time in a single blocking thread (true), or process every event in a new non-blocking thread (false). This function only updates a single window You can use setConfig(wcUiEventBlocking, ...) to update all windows. 
proc setFileHandler(window: csize_t; handler: proc (filename: cstring;
    length: ptr cint): pointer {.cdecl.}) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_file_handler", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set a custom handler to serve files. 
proc setHide(window: csize_t; status: bool) {.cdecl, importc: "webui_set_hide",
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set a window in hidden mode. Should be called before show(). 
proc setHighContrast(window: csize_t; status: bool) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_high_contrast", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Setup the window with high-contrast support. Useful when you want to build a better high-contrast theme with CSS. 
proc setIcon(window: csize_t; icon: cstring; type: cstring) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_icon", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set the default embedded HTML favicon. 
proc setKiosk(window: csize_t; status: bool) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_kiosk", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set the window in Kiosk mode (Full screen) 
proc setPort(window: csize_t; port: csize_t): bool {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_port", discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set a custom web-server network port to be used by WebUI. This can be useful to determine the HTTP link of webui.js in case you are trying to use WebUI with an external web-server like NGNIX 
proc setPosition(window: csize_t; x: cuint; y: cuint) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_position", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set the window position. 
proc setProfile(window: csize_t; name: cstring; path: cstring) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_profile", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set the web browser profile to use. An empty name and path means the default user profile. Must be called before show(). 
proc setProxy(window: csize_t; proxy_server: cstring) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_proxy", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set the web browser to use proxy_server. Must be called before show(). 
proc setPublic(window: csize_t; status: bool) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_public", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Allow a specific window address to be accessible from a public network 
proc setRootFolder(window: csize_t; path: cstring): bool {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_root_folder", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set the web-server root folder path for a specific window. 
proc setRuntime(window: csize_t; runtime: csize_t) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_runtime", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Chose between Deno and Nodejs as runtime for .js and .ts files. 
proc setSize(window: csize_t; width: cuint; height: cuint) {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_set_size", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set the window size. 
proc setTimeout(second: csize_t) {.cdecl, importc: "webui_set_timeout",
                                   ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set the maximum time in seconds to wait for the browser to start. 
proc setTlsCertificate(certificate_pem: cstring; private_key_pem: cstring): bool {.
    cdecl, importc: "webui_set_tls_certificate", ...raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Set the SSL/TLS certificate and the private key content, both in PEM format. This works only with webui-2-secure library. If set empty WebUI will generate a self-signed certificate. 
proc show(window: csize_t; content: cstring): bool {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_show", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Show a window using embedded HTML, or a file. If the window is already open, it will be refreshed. 
proc showBrowser(window: csize_t; content: cstring; browser: csize_t): bool {.
    cdecl, importc: "webui_show_browser", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Same as show(), but using a specific web browser. 
proc showWv(window: csize_t; content: cstring): bool {.cdecl,
    importc: "webui_show_wv", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Show a WebView window using embedded HTML, or a file. If the window is already open, it will be refreshed.
Note: Windows needs WebView2Loader.dll.
proc wait() {.cdecl, importc: "webui_wait", ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Wait until all opened windows get closed.
